title: Can not send email after reinstalling Thunderbird
content: I had to wipe out my computer and re-install Thunderbird. Unfortunately, I did not back up the latest Thunderbird profile, but had to use an earlier profile I had backed up. Now I can receive all emails, but cannot send any emails. (I am able to send email through Spectrum webmail.) In Spectrum, I have a main account, and 3 subaccounts. In the Outgoing Server SMPT settings in Thunderbird, where it asks User Name, which email account do I use, the main one or one of the subaccounts? I seems the SMPT setting is for both the main and the three subaccounts, not for each separately. Also, is there something else I need to do as I didn’t back up the latest Thunderbird profile? Thanks!
creator: jojotom748

title: 邮件附件不展示

creator: jon31512

title: Some folders (e.g. '[Gmail]/All Mail on xxxxxx@gmail.com') cannot be compacted because there is not enough free disk space. Please delete some files and try again.
content:
I get a message like this every time I start Thunderbird. The topic came up last year but the conclusion was along the lines of "...this problem will be fixed in version 128" but it was never clear whether or not the User followed Mozilla's support replies or what they had to do to clear the email message from Thunderbird. .....Well I'm running version 128.1.1esr and the problem still exists.

My questions:

1. What is Thunderbird trying to do? Compact individual email files? Compae from ct the whole Thunderbird Profiles folder?

2. Is the problem the size of the Profiles folder or the overall size of the hard drive the Profiles folder resides on? What is the Hard/solidstate drive is the maximum?

3. Is the problem related to the amount of Free Space left on the Hard/solidstate drive or is the issue the number of individual files?

4. Is the issue related to the number of Thunderbird files and/or folders OR is it related to the total number of files and/or folders on the hard drive?

5. Is there a limit to the number of sub-folder levels that Thunderbird can navigate?

Thank you.

Tom

Tom O'Brien TOBrienArchitect@gmail.com
creator: TOBrienArchitect

title: reduce email memory hold
content: Aiming to reduce memory used by my email. I have both Sent and Sent Mail folders. My preference would be to eliminate the duplication that takes place with the two. I understand that I can not unsubscribe from Sent Mail. Could Sent content be reduced to the items that are NOT in Sent Mail? Alternatives? My Sent folder contains more older files which I would like to retain but do not want to "try" something that MIGHT eliminate them. I am on a Mac23 with Latest Sonoma. Thunderbird on Gmail.
creator: jjg555

title: Is there a possibility to reload Thunderbird's Sent indexes from for example C# code?
content:
Hello. I'm developing simple shedule app. Already I finished project but I have a problem with Thunderbird. In my app user's can send invitation's to another user's and important thing is sender must have this message in the Send folder. I have done it but to see this message user must repair index of Sent folder. Is there any possibility to reload this index from code or script? I tried deleting Sent.msf file but during Thunderbird working it's blocked and I can't get access to it until I close Thunderbird.

After I reload index manually everything is right and messages are visible.
creator: robert251346

title: Thunderbird still tries to synchronize a deleted Gmail account
content: Hello. So I had a work Gmail account on Thunderbird which I no longer use. I have deleted the account from Thunderbird, removed all related contacts in the Address Book as well as all Calendar events related to it, as well as all outbound server settings, etc. But Thunderbird still tries to sync to the account every 15 minutes. Would anyone know what else I need to do to stop this syncing? Thanks for any suggestions. Celine
creator: m.celine.grech
